sen.j: 橘御井子（たちばな の みいこ、生没年不詳）は、平安時代初期の女官。
sen.e: TACHIBANA no Miiko (date of birth and death unknown) was a court lady who lived in the beginning of the Heian period.
TACHIBANA no Miiko (date of birth and death unknown) was a court lady who lived at the beginning of the Heian Period.
TACHIBANA no Miiko (year of birth and death unknown) was a court lady who lived at the beginning of the Heian Period.
Her father was TACHIBANA no Irii, Benkan (an official of the Dajokan (Grand Council of State)).
Her father was TACHIBANA no Irii, a Benkan (an official of the Dajokan or Grand Council of State).
Her father was TACHIBANA no Irii, a Benkan (an official of the Dajokan or Grand Council of State).

sen.j: 橘逸勢・橘永名・橘永継・橘田村子（桓武天皇宮人）らの姉妹で、檀林皇后橘嘉智子（嵯峨天皇皇后）の従姉妹。
sen.e: She was a sister of TACHIBANA no Hayanari, TACHIBANA no Nagana, TACHIBANA no Nagatsugu, TACHIBANA no Tamurako (a court lady of the Emperor Kanmu) and others, and a cousin of TACHIBANA no Kachiko, the Empress Danrin (the Empress of Emperor Saga).

She was a sister of TACHIBANA no Hayanari, TACHIBANA no Nagana, TACHIBANA no Nagatsugu, TACHIBANA no Tamurako (a court lady of the Emperor Kanmu) among others, and a cousin of TACHIBANA no Kachiko, the Empress Danrin (the Empress of Emperor Saga).

She was a sister of TACHIBANA no Hayanari, TACHIBANA no Nagana, TACHIBANA no Nagatsugu, TACHIBANA no Tamurako (a court lady of the Emperor Kanmu) among others, and a cousin of TACHIBANA no Kachiko, the Empress Danrin (the Empress of Emperor Saga).

sen.j: 桓武天皇の女御となり、賀楽内親王・菅原内親王の母となった。
sen.e: She became nyogo (a high-ranking lady in the court (a consort of an emperor)) of the Emperor Kanmu and gave birth to the Imperial Princess Kara and the Imperial Princess Sugawara.
She became a nyogo (a high-ranking lady in the court, and a consort of the emperor)) of Emperor Kanmu and gave birth to Imperial Princess Kara and the Imperial Princess Sugawara.
She became a nyogo (a high-ranking lady in the court, and a consort of the emperor) of Emperor Kanmu and gave birth to Imperial Princess Kara and Imperial Princess Sugawara.
sen.cmt: ))→)２番目の Imperial Princess の theを削除

sen.j: 弘仁6年（815年）7月従四位下に叙され、仁明天皇の代になった嘉祥2年（849年）閏12月に従三位となった。
sen.e: On August 815, she was assigned to Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) and promoted to Jusani (Junior Third Rank) on January 850 in the era of the Emperor Ninmyo.
In August 815 she attained the position of Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) and was promoted to Jusani (Junior Third Rank) in January 850 in the era of Emperor Ninmyo.
In August 815 she attained the position of Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) and was promoted to Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) in January 850 in the era of Emperor Ninmyo.
